This site collects a **small set of practical resources** on synthetic-control-style counterfactuals for **panel data** (single/few treated units, extensions to multiple/staggered).

**What’s in the slides**
- Motivation via **single treated unit** (comparative case study)
- SCM as “**construct a counterfactual trajectory**”
- A compact map of extensions (SCM ↔ SDID ↔ outcome-model/low-rank ideas)
- Minimal simulation notebook + code you can reuse

::: {.callout-tip appearance="simple"}
If you only remember one thing: **diagnostics** (pre-fit, placebo tests, donor pool sanity) matter more than the estimator label.

## Key references (starter set)

- Abadie (2021) — SCM overview and practical guidance  
- Arkhangelsky et al. (2021) — Synthetic Difference-in-Differences  
- Ben-Michael et al. (2021) — Augmented SCM

## Software (what to use)

- **`scpi`** — classical SCM + inference tooling (and implementations across languages)
- `synthdid` — SDID reference implementation
- `augsynth` — augmented / bias-corrected SCM workflows
